title: Meta Board Resolves Investors’ Privacy Claims for $190 Million
description: Billionaire Mark Zuckerberg and other Meta Platforms Inc. directors agreed to a $190 million settlement of claims they failed to rectify repeated violations of Facebook users’ privacy and improperly engineered an accord to protect Zuckerberg from personal liability for the privacy missteps, court filings show.

title: Nvidia’s Post-Earnings Rally Fades After Bubble Fears Return
description: A rally in Nvidia Corp. shares fizzled on Thursday after investors shrugged off a stronger-than-expected revenue forecast and assurances that the AI economy isn’t in a bubble.

title: Morgan Stanley Sells ABS Deal After Delay Over Alibaba Risk
description: Banks led by Morgan Stanley have finalized the sale of $589 million in data center bonds by ServerFarm, after delaying the deal on concerns over the data centers’ reliance on revenue from Chinese technology giant Alibaba Group Holding Ltd.
